name: Embassy Suites Hotel Chicago Downtown Lakefront

reviews.text: The Embassy Suites Downtown Lakefront is a great place to stay if you have kids and/or running the Chicago Marathon.
reviews.title: Great hotel for kids and/or Chicago Marathon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The property has a great location. Easy walking distance or short cab ride to Michigan Ave. shopping, River North dining, Navy Pier, Grant Park, and the lakefront museums.
reviews.title: Nice Place for Weekend Getaway

reviews.text: I walked to the start line, which was less than a mile away.
reviews.title: Would not return

reviews.text: Embassy Suites are great for families. The 2 bedroom suites give families extra space. The inclusive breakfast is also very nice.
reviews.title: You Can Do Better

reviews.text: The hotel is clean and has a new feel. The elevators are very fast. Unfortunately, you do need to change elevators to go down to street level.
reviews.title: Loved it, loved the managers reception, loved the breakfast

reviews.text: If you are looking for a clean, comfortable hotel with friendly, courteous and professional staff, the Embassy Suites Lakefront Chicago is for you. Every staff person I encountered was friendly, from the bellman to the cleaning staff. To make up for some inconvenience with our booking (which was alleviated before our arrival), the hotel had a room available for us when we arrived early, and as a thank you to us for being flexible, the manager delivered fresh fruit and bottled juices to our room shortly after we checked in. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. It's only two blocks from Michigan Ave and right on the shuttle route for Navy Pier. The complimentary breakfast is more than sufficient with a variety of delicious items as well as a "cook to order" station for omelets, etc. Afternoon cocktails and appetizers are offered in the atrium in a relaxing, fun atmosphere. Other hotels take note -- this is the way a hotel should be run!
reviews.title: This is the way to run a hotel

reviews.text: Staff was very friendly and courteous as mentioned in other reviews. Check-In was a breeze and I was able to check in 2 hours prior to 4pm. Pool is small but it wasn't a concern to me as I wasn't there to swim! My husband loved the jacuzzi.
reviews.title: Love Embassy Suites Hotels!

reviews.text: Great location as hotel is within walking distance of Magnificent Mile, Field Museum, Shedd Aquarium and The Loop.
reviews.title: Great Location; OK Place
Great hotel
reviews.text: Breakfast Buffet and Manager's Reception are exellent. Seating area is large although the Manager's Reception can get quite crowded if there is a conference within the hotel. Lines long for drinks but bartenders moved very efficiently. Sitting area a little bit cold during Breakfast Buffet so take a light cover.

reviews.title: Good for families
reviews.text: Room was great. Spacious, clean and 2 TVs!! And although there was a family next door with little ones we couldn't hear them at all!!! Elevators (all 4) arrived within seconds when requested.

I recently stayed at the Embassy Suites Downtown Lakefornt and it was just perfect! A perfect location, close to the Magnificent Mile and the Navy Pier. Our room was great. Everyone at the hotel were so friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend staying there!!
reviews.title: Embassy Suites Downtown Lakefront was perfect!

reviews.text: This was a great place to stay for families or otherwise. The room rate was $199. It was clean but not overly fancy. Right in the heart of downtown within walking distance to shops and restaurants. We took our daughter and the room was perfect for her to stay up and watch TV in the living room while my wife and I had the separate bedroom. The suite was huge with a great view of the lake and the river. The staff was outstanding, friendly, accommodating. The manager's reception was a nice touch, unlimited beer, wine, cocktails saved us from paying $6 a drink elsewhere. The breakfast buffet was just average but there is enough food to fill you up and saved on breakfast tabs downtown. We couldn't have been happier and will stay there again.
reviews.title: Excellent!
Would Recommend
reviews.text: Our family stayed here recently and I would definately recommend this hotel to other travelers. All hotel staff was polite from the staff at the check in desk, breakfast staff, cocktail servers at the complimentary reception each evening to the doormen who flagged down a cab for us each day. The location worked great for us. We took cabs to some museums, but this hotel was walking distance to the John Hancock tower, Michigan Avenue, The Art Institute and Navy Pier. You may pay a little extra for Embassy Suites, but with the hot breakfast and the complimentary cocktail reception, you get your money's worth.
The pool area was small as is the case with all downtown hotels if they even have a pool, but with our busy schedule, the small pool/hot tub served our purpose at the end of a busy day.
reviews.title: Good choice for families staying downtown
Nice, but pricey
reviews.text: Love Chicago and would stay here again.

reviews.title: Good for families, but maybe too good--breakfast traffic worse than the Dan Ryan
reviews.text: We booked a 2-night stay here for our family of 4 + baby (2 adults, a 5-year-old, a 3-year-old, and a 3-month-old). Obviously, traveling with such a group is never going to be seamless, but we were pretty happy with the room (12th fl, great view south towards the AON Center). It was a "King Suite", so my wife and I and the baby slept in the King, with the two kids on the sofa bed in the front room.

reviews.title: Very nice hotel and friendly staff
reviews.text: Besides the two-room setup with fridge and microwave, another huge plus for staying here with kids is that there's a Dominick's grocery store directly across the street (and FYI, your Safeway card seems to work there). That saved us the first night when everyone was too tired to endure a dinner outing and we bought dinner and other supplies from there.

Friday morning's free breakfast was a total fiasco. The line was about 20 minutes or more to get your food, seats were hard to come by, and they kept on running out of things like plates and silverware. It was obvious that the crowd was 90% families, which obviously slows things down. There wasn't any obvious way to help the situation (other than maybe keeping supplies filled so that people aren't disrupting the flow by barging into another line to get a fork). It really started our day off on a sour note. Inexplicably, I never saw the lines get out of hand on Saturday morning though. My guess is that so many people had been traumatized by Friday's scene that they either sent one family member down to fill a tray for the rest (as we did) or they just went to Dominick's or some other place for breakfast.
reviews.title: Save yourself a headache and stay someplace else
Very Good Choice...but TONS of kids over the 4th of July Weekend
reviews.text: Another drawback is the fact that you need to take an elevator from street level up to the 5th-floor "Sky Lobby" and a second one up to your room. Just a pain when you're going back and forth (e.g. if you're playing the parking meter game, see below).

Parking charges are always punitive in downtown hotels, and this one is no exception. $39/night to valet park, $32 to self-park. We managed to get through our two nights with only about $25 in charges (a $53 savings). There are meters immediately south of the hotel and to the east on that same block (between the Sheraton and Illinois Ave). They run 9 am to 9 pm, so if you get a spot at night, you don't have to get up at dawn to move it. The lot which is located southwest across the intersection of Illinois and Columbus from the hotel charges $22 for 24 hours (with, obviously, no in and out priveleges), so we did use that for a long stint that first night. Another parking location that can be attempted is the lowest of the 3 levels of Wacker Drive, just south of the Chicago river. The meters are 7am - 7 pm, though, and there are quite a few homeless people living down there, so I can't vouch for the security of it. I'd definitely park there during the day (and I did), but chickened out for the overnight stint.
reviews.title: Very nice

description: The Embassy Suites Chicago Downtown/Lakefront hotel is located just 2 blocks from Chicago's Navy Pier and the Magnificent Mile Michigan Ave Shopping! This downtown Chicago hotel is within walking distance to many Chicago attractions such as Millennium Park, Water Tower Place and the Hancock Observatory. Our location and amenities make the Embassy Suites Chicago Downtown/Lakefront an ideal choice for the business or leisure traveler! Guests of the hotel stay in a upscale spacious two-room suite complete with a refrigerator, microwave oven and flexible work/dining space.
